data.title: Summer Holiday: Ingenious Inventions
data.meta_description: Experience the biggest day out in history this Summer Holidays. Live displays, activities, vehicle rides, and more at Dorset's largest indoor attraction.
data.text:
Summer holiday fun for the whole family to enjoy. Tank displays, kids’ activities, tank-themed play areas, and more!

The Tank Museum brings the story of tanks and their crews to life. Experience the biggest day out in history with interactive exhibitions, 300 tanks, Ingenious Invention themed activities, and more at Dorset’s largest indoor attraction.

Get involved with hands-on games and interactives, watch live tanks in action and experience a tracked vehicle ride. Show off your creative genius in the new ‘Design Your Own Tank’ Competition or see detailed models of tanks and how to make them , plus, see the tank-themed outdoor playpark for mini-tank enthusiasts.

Key Details

Invention-themed activities 22 July – 1 September

Open daily 9.30am-5pm

Tanks in Action Displays 1pm Mon-Thurs and vehicle rides every day

Kids’ activities, tours and trails

‘Design Your Own Tank’ Competition – New For 2024!

Allow 4-5hrs for your visit

Amazing day out Absolutely amazing. We went as our son is really into tanks and WWll.

We had a great day out, the people were friendly and helpful. The food was reasonably priced and once you’ve paid you get free admission for a year.

We will definitely be going again.

read moreread less

BeccaDACB

Tank you for the experience!!! Absolutely fabulous day out with the family. We had teenagers and a 9 year old with us and there was so much to do. Everyone was entertained amd this place suites ages from 1-100! From the pyrotechnics and off road Vehicle experience to the interactive video games, there was something to suit everyone. Lots of imaginative play and tonnes of information to be gained. We spent 5 hours there, plus .the bonus, you pay once and it gives you a 12 month pass .so if you are local, you can explore time and time again. And even if you aren't local, it's still well worth a visit.

One of the best museums I have ever visited and the staff were all so friendly and super knowledgeable

A great day out for the family

read moreread less

Julie G

Was it for me or the kids? Such a great day out, took my two boys (4-7) at the time. This is a full day out, lots to see and do. The setup of the place is brilliant and easy to navigate. The sheer size of the entire exhibition blew me away, it just kept going and going! Will definitely go back again in a few years when the kids are a bit older to appreciate it all over again. 10/10 day out with the kids!

read moreread less

ALEXHORDER

I loved it Absolutely amazing, don’t really have a bad word to say. There was something to do for everyone, quite well priced. Incredibly informative but didn’t bombard you with it. Great for all ages. It turns out the tickets get you in for a full year which is great. Some of the bits about concentration camps brought a tear to my eye. It was incredibly well done.

read moreread less

keelyshenton5

Best day out. A very warm welcome from the staff. Everything was well laid out. The information boards were full of information. It literally is a whole day out, so it's great value for money.

read moreread less

Gemma B

Absolutely fantastic! A must do day out Absolutely fantastic day out. The entry pass is actually an annual pass which I hadn’t realised so that’s a great bonus. Staff everywhere are so helpful and have fantastic knowledge. There is everything for adults, teens and young children to do. A fabulous day out, well worth it! Will definitely be back.

read moreread less

The_Pilot_Wife

FAMILY DAY OUT This was by far the best day out during our recent holiday. We went on the local bus from Weymouth. A lovely drive through the country on a lovely summers day. We arrived at the Tank Museum with a complete open mind - we knew there would be hundreds of tanks but the whole experience was moving, emotional and thoroughly entertaining. The history and effects were brilliant and I would definitely recommend this as a must see if you are heading down to Poole, Bournemeouth or Weymouth are.

read moreread less

amaturediner

Informative and absorbing First went to the Tank Museum in the late 50's on a school trip. A post war boys dream a giant hanger full of tanks you could crawl all over ( pre health & safety.) Later visits through the years normally as a result of rain at Weymouth have seen the museum evolve into the first class museum you can see today. You journey through the history of the Tank through time, illustrated by the actual vehicles of the period. I particularly enjoyed the individual video's about and made by the men who served. Light and airy you can take your time and not be overwhelmed by the exhibits as in the past. Would certainly return using the year ticket. Reasonably priced online tickets, plenty of parking. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable. The only downside was the restaurant , crowded service area.

read moreread less

Richard J

An amazing day out. What an amazing place to visit.

Recommend you wear comfy shoes as there is a lot of walking.

I never realised how many types of tanks there were.

The staff were very helpful.

An amazing day out

read moreread less

Ann F

See armoured vehicles roar round the arena

At 1pm Monday – Thursdays during the holidays until 31 August

Live tank battle, lifelike explosions, and the opportunity to get into the arena and participate in the display

Meet the crew and get close to the vehicles from the display afterwards

Get into the arena yourself with a vehicle ride.

Available 22 July – 1 September

Mon-Thurs 10:30-12:00 & 13:45-16:15 and Fri-Sun 10:30-13:00 & 14:00-16:15

Ride in a real tracked vehicle – a Cold War M548 troop carrier

£4 per person or £13.50 for a family of four, pay on the day – card only.

Visitors must be over 1.25m tall

New for 2024 – Design Your Own Tank Competition!

Design your own tank using the form HERE, or on your visit to The Tank Museum during the Summer Holidays.

There will be five winners drawn throughout August and five Tank Museum goodie bags up for grabs.

Children can submit their entry in the Tamiya Hall in The Tank Museum. Postal entries are also accepted.

Check out the form HERE for full terms and conditions and to enter.

There’s loads of family fun at The Tank Museum!

Our ten powerful exhibitions are full of interactives suitable for all ages, with games, puzzles, and hands-on activities

A tank-themed outdoor play area for mini tank-fans

Children can explore with our free Commander Basil trail

Free soft play and colouring in the Tamiya hall

Dressing up, trails and talks throughout the Museum

Activities & Timings

TIME

ACTIVITY

LOCATION

All holiday, All day

Outdoor Play Area

Climb on our Centurion & Mark II in the new outdoor play area. Children must be supervised at all times.

Outside The Main Museum

Tank Museum Volunteer Modellers

See detailed models of tanks and find out how to make them.

Tank Story Hall

Soft Play

Free soft play and colouring. Children must be supervised at all times.

Tamiya Hall

Ingenious Inventions Craft Station

Colour in famous inventors and tanks or have a go at solving our ingenious puzzles.

Tamiya Hall

Design Your Own Tank Competitions

Are you an ingenious inventor? Or do you dream of flying tanks, tracks and sprockets? Now’s your chance, Design your own tank and enter our weekly competition to be in with a chance to win a prize!

Tamiya Hall

Top Trumps Trail

There are 12 Giant Top Trumps Cards around the Museum. Find the secret card to win an exclusive Top Trumps that does not appear in any pack.

Museum Wide

Make Your Own Top Trumps Card

Be inspired by the Tank Museum’s new Top Trumps pack and even make your own card to take home.

Tanks For The Memories

Every day, 13:30 - 15:00

Vehicle Conservation Centre Balcony Open

View our extended collection from the viewing balcony.

Vehicle Conservation Centre

Every Day, 10:00-15:00

Battlefield Breakthroughs

Discover the inventions that became turning points in war from the first tank to modern warfare and beyond.

Museum Wide

Mon-Thurs, 13:45-14:15

Meet The Crew From Tanks In Action

Meet the crew who drive our ingenious inventions during Tanks in Action.

Vehicle Conservation Centre Apron

Everyday, timings vary

Vehicle Rides in the Arena

Get the chance to ride inside a tracked vehicle in our very own Arena!

£4 Single, £13.50 Family Minimum Height of 125cm

Monday-Thursday: 10:30-12:00 & 13:45-16:15

Friday-Sunday: 10:30-13:00 & 14:00-16:00

Kuwait Arena

Mon-Thurs, 13:00-13:30

Live Tanks in Action

See armoured vehicles in action, find out how they work together in battle.

Kuwait Arena

27 Jul, 13:00-13:30

One Man and his Gundogs

Join Stephen Harrison and his gundogs for an entertaining & educational demonstration of dog training methods, gundog skills and a wonderful array of tricks! After the demonstration, Stephen will be available after the show for people wishing to ask any questions or just to meet the dogs!

Kuwait Arena

Fridays and Saturdays, 11:00 - 14:00

Diamond Faces – Face painting

£2.50 per child

Tank Story Hall

Supported By:

Murco, a motor fuel group brand, supports The Tank Museum’s arena action during TANKFEST, Tiger Day, and Tanks in Action by providing fuel for the historic running vehicles. You can find out more about Murco HERE.
